channel.title: Do I Need Port Forwarding For
channel.description:
Modem --> D Link Ethernet Broadband Router ---> My Laptop
The Ethernet is NOT wireless. I'm using a cord to connect to the internet.
Do I need to portforward? Cause I run my IP on the No-Ip client, and I "runserver" and I can't log onto my server via Moparscape Client IP:my no-ip.
Also, if I do have to portforward, when I type in my defualt to the adress bar, the login screen comes up, and I tried that there was no username and the pass was 'admin' and it acess denied...sooooo help please
Thanks, Play For Keeps

item.title: Do I Need Port Forwarding For
item.dc:creator: @Play_For_Keeps Play For Keeps
item.description:
@Play_For_Keeps wrote:

alright, i’ll try that later

Read full topic

item.title: Do I Need Port Forwarding For
item.dc:creator: @mresi5656 mresi5656
item.description:
@mresi5656 wrote:

Are you using a router or modem?
Router: Multiple ethernet outlets
Modem: Just one.

Read full topic
item.source: Do I Need Port Forwarding For

item.title: Do I Need Port Forwarding For
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

no,
for ip use 127.0.0.1,
and double check your port, itll say it when you run your run.bat

Read full topic
item.source: Do I Need Port Forwarding For
